member.summary: Leaves no stone unturned in searching for a type from a String without having to be as specific as with Type.GetType()

member.summary: Leaves no stone unturned in searching for a type from a String without having to be as specific as with Type.GetType()
member.param: A string that can be a simple name or include namespaces. See examples
Keys are namespaces, values are assembly names. These can make searching for runtime known types much faster and safer
Tries to parse the type name as a generic. If it's known not to be, it's faster to set this to false
member.example: MyAssembly.dll, MyProduct.MyNamespace.MyTypeName which would be faster than not specifying the assembly name

member.summary: Create a Json string from any object. For more options set the Settings property of the serializer instance or the factory on which this is invoked

member.summary: Serialize up or down. Only the properties of TTarget will be serialized

member.name: M:Das.Serializer.IXmlSerializer.ToXmlAsync(System.Object,System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: User friendly/less performant save to disk. Keeps whole serialized string in memory then dumps to file when ready. Creates the directory for the file if it doesn't already exist

member.name: M:Das.Serializer.IXmlSerializer.ToXmlAsync``1(System.Object,System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: Tries to ensure no empty files if the process cuts off during invocation. Recommended for small files like config The downside is that if this is a big object then it's all going into memory. For a lighter, more dangerous way of saving xml to disk use XmlToStream with a FileStream

member.name: F:Das.Serializer.NodeTypes.Fallback
member.summary: Serialize using BinaryFormatter or ToString()

member.name: T:Das.Serializer.ITextAccessor
member.summary: Abstraction for reading one character at a time for a string/builder etc

member.name: F:Das.Serializer.CircularReference.IgnoreObject
member.summary: For XML and Json, does not include the guilty tag. For binary pretends it was null

member.name: F:Das.Serializer.CircularReference.SerializePath
member.summary: For Json, makes an attribute with a Json path like "$ref": "$.Root.Ref1.Ref2 which allows the reference to be restored upon deserialization. Binary does the same. XML uses an XPath

member.name: F:Das.Serializer.CircularReference.ThrowException
member.summary: Throws an exception and the serialization fails

member.name: P:Das.Serializer.ISerializerSettings.CacheTypeConstructors
member.summary: Specifies whether ConstructorInfo methods will be turned into delegates and cached for faster object instantiation. This can cause issues with anonymous types and is automatically disabled in contexts where one is being deserialized

member.name: P:Das.Serializer.ISerializerSettings.Indentation
member.summary: Allows control over how much nested elements in json and xml are indented. Use whitespace like spaces and tabs only

member.name: P:Das.Serializer.ISerializerSettings.IsUseAttributesInXml
member.summary: Using attributes can make the markup smaller but can limit compatibility with other serializers

member.name: P:Das.Serializer.ISerializerSettings.PrintPropertyNameFormat
member.summary: Particularly for Json pascal case is often used. Setting this to false and having multiple properties with the "same" name will be problematic

member.name: P:Das.Serializer.ISerializerSettings.PropertyNotFoundBehavior
member.summary: If data exists in markup but no property can be found for the known type that is being deserialized to.

member.name: P:Das.Serializer.ISerializerSettings.PropertySearchDepth
member.summary: Defines the depth of the search to resolve elements to their types when deserializing text as JSON or XML

member.name: P:Das.Serializer.ISerializerSettings.TypeNotFoundBehavior
member.summary: If an unknown type is in the serialized data, a dynamic type can be built at runtime including properties.

member.name: P:Das.Serializer.ISerializerSettings.TypeSearchNameSpaces
member.summary: Types from xml/json that are not namespace or assembly qualified will be searched for in this collection of namespaces. Defaults to just System

member.name: P:Das.Serializer.ISerializerSettings.TypeSpecificity
member.summary: Specifies under which circumstances the serializer will embed type information for properties. For xml the type of the root object is always the root node. Choosing All will cause the Json and binary formats to wrap their output in an extra node which may make it impossible for other deserializers or services to understand the data

member.name: P:Das.Serializer.ISerializerSettings.IsFormatSerializedText
member.summary: Setting this to false makes for less overall text due to no line breaks, indentation, etc

member.name: M:Das.Serializer.ISerializerSettings.GetPrintScanSignature
member.summary: Provides a unique integer value for the values of: IsUseAttributesInXml, TypeSpecificity, IsFormatSerializedText, PrintPropertyNameFormat, ScanPropertyNameFormat, IsOmitDefaultValues

member.name: P:Das.Serializer.ISerializationDepth.IsOmitDefaultValues
member.summary: In Xml/Json only. 0 for integers, false for booleans, and any val == default will be ommitted from the markup

member.name: P:Das.Serializer.ISerializationDepth.SerializationDepth
member.summary: Allows to set whether properties without setters and whether private fields will be serialized. Default is GetSetProperties

member.name: T:Das.Serializer.ISettingsUser
member.summary: Base interface for any type with a public property of type ISerializerSettings

member.name: T:Das.Serializer.TextPropertySearchDepths
member.summary: For text deserialization, the amount of effort that should be expended to resolve properties. For most use cases, the JSON name should map to an easily mappable property as should the or the XML node or tag. When dealing with markup whose format is externally defined, it may produce better results to broaden these parameters.

member.name: F:Das.Serializer.TextPropertySearchDepths.ResolveByPropertyName
member.summary: Searches only in the type being deserialized (assuming it's known). Does not provide enough flexibility to deserialize something like HTML where the tags like "label" refer to what are type names rather than properties.

member.name: F:Das.Serializer.TextPropertySearchDepths.AsTypeInNamespacesAndSystem
member.summary: Searches as property names but also as types within a predefined collection of namespaces. This is an appropriate option for markup deserialization

member.name: F:Das.Serializer.TextPropertySearchDepths.AsTypeInLoadedModules
member.summary: Will search all loaded modules for a type that matches by name alone. Sensible when producing dynamic types where flexbility is important. For example custom reporting where the dynamic type will be bound against grid columns

member.name: F:Das.Serializer.SerializationDepth.GetSetProperties
member.summary: Considers only properties with getters and setters. Private fields and properties without setters are not serialized/deserialized.

member.name: F:Das.Serializer.TypeNotFoundBehavior.GenerateRuntime
member.summary: Attempt to generate a dynamic type at runtime

member.name: F:Das.Serializer.TypeNotFoundBehavior.ThrowException
member.summary: Throw an exception if no type can be determined from any piece of data

member.name: F:Das.Serializer.TypeSpecificity.None
member.summary: Selecting this option will cause type specifications to never be included in serialized data. Doing this may make it impossible to deserialize your data if your classes have properties of type Object, abstract classes, or interfaces.

member.name: F:Das.Serializer.TypeSpecificity.Discrepancy
member.summary: Selecting this option will embed type data only for data that is typed as Object or as an interface/abstract class. Selecting this option will create somewhat of a proprietary data format that may cause problems being consumed by other applications but is necessary in most cases to deserialize. This is the default setting

member.name: F:Das.Serializer.TypeSpecificity.All
member.summary: Selecting this option will embed type information into every piece of data. This option will generate the largest amount of bytes and be the slowest. However, choosing this option allows for deserialization under nearly all circumstances - even when dynamic types have to be generated.

member.name: T:Das.Serializer.IBinaryContext
member.summary: Stateless facade for binary deserialization

member.name: T:Das.Serializer.ISerializationState
member.summary: A stateful, non threadsafe context that forms the basis of serialization/deserialization transactions

member.summary: Throws an exception when a circular reference is detected

member.name: T:Das.Serializer.CircularReferences.IgnoringCircularReferenceHandler
member.summary: Changes circular references to null property values

member.name: M:Das.Streamers.BinaryFeeder.GetNextType
member.summary: takes the next 4 bytes for length then the next N bytes and turns them into a Type
Returns the type along with property/method delegates. Results are cached.
member.param: The returned type may not get this exact name if a type with the same name was created/invalidated
List of properties to be added to the type. Properties from an abstract base type or implemented interface(s) are added without specifying them here
Specifies whether the PublicGetters and PublicSetters properties should have delegates to quickly get/set values for properties.
public events to be published by the Type
For interface implementations, the methods are created but they return default primitives or null references
Can be a single unsealed class and/or 1-N interfaces

member.summary: Returns the type cached if it exists, builds/caches it otherwise
member.param: The name of the type to be created
or interface implementations, the methods are created but they return default primitives or null references
properties from parent types do not need to be specified
public events to be published by the Type
Can contain maximum one class and any amount of interfaces

member.summary: Prepends type search namespaces to name and tries to find. From just a single token we can never find anything
